job_title: Registered Nurse in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Great company, friendly supportive managers, autonomy, sign on bonus, can make own schedule. Prompt delivery of pt supplies, meds. Caring teams to provide the best hospice care out there. We provide such a vital service and are truly appreciated for all the compassion and care we bring to the patient and family.
cons: It’s sad to see every patient pass in a few days, but that’s the outcome of Crisis Care Nursing. We can always say we made it easier for the patient and loved ones to accept and travel through this difficult time.

review_title: You Get Back What You Put In
job_title: Team Member in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Excellent benefit package including generous PTO allowances (best I've ever seen).  Amazing and talented co-workers (except for the usual complainers you find everywhere these day).  Progressive company who owns their "mistakes" and take action to correct.  Many, many perks: massages at work, exercise facility, garage parking, numerous discounts for local businesses.  AND, most importantly, they really care about their patients.
cons:
Pay raises are annual, but "slow" so negotiate your best rate when hired.  
BIGGEST POINT TO MAKE:  I read most of the other reviews-MOST of the "cons" were simply unfounded.  I know the workforce here and I could even identify some of the people who probably wrote the complaints.  It is sad, but, there are too many people in our world who want something for nothing; when they don't get it, they complain.  Entitlement runs rampant.  Laziness has become a disease and grumbling a hobby.  My question to those who are still working here and yet hate it so much:  Why stay??  Is it because you have good benefits and wages?  Is it because it provides a good living for you and your family?  Just curious.  Yes it is a business.  Yes it focuses on operating in the black.  IT IS NON_PROFIT!!  We take care of people and even you are getting your slice of the pie.  Change your attitude and straighten up your work ethics-perhaps you will not only make an honest living, but you will also enjoy it!

job_title: Chief Clinical Officer in Riviera Beach, FL
pros: Our team is committed to quality patient care
cons: No cons; we work as a team to work through issues and opportunities

review_title: Many resources for patients and families

job_title: Registered Nurse in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Access to Health care insurance, employee health nurse available, flu shots made available. Many choices made available for admissions in the south and north ends of county. Probably too many beds now as fewer patients are being admitted within last 6 months. Something is going on in the once decent respected hospice of palm beach county. Matt Lauer left and so did our reputation.
cons: Staff are stressed unhappy and leaving because of instability changes layoffs extended hours responsibilities and higher acuities expectations with less staff. Moral is at an all time low. NOW looking to hire as many good staff have been run off. The organization of compassion is gone.

job_title: Director in West Palm Beach, FL
pros:
It's great to care about what you do and feel as though you are making a difference.  The work is very rewarding.  The pay is competitive and the benefits are great!  Incorporating our employees in all our business plans, initiatives, six sigma projects.
Clinical Ladder Program and salary upgrades
White Belt/Yellow Belt/Green Belt Education
Nurse Residency Program
Promote internal promotions/transfers
Tuition Reimbursement and salary upgrades
Tickets to events (Honda Classic, Plays, Football games, etc.)
Employee Referral Program
Cash Bonuses
Gift Cards
Discount South Florida Fair tickets
Soft Benefits - Employee Perks and Discounts
Employee Uniforms
3% Retirement contributions
Generous Employer contributions toward Medical and Dental Insurance Premiums
Free Life Insurance for employee, spouse and dependent children
Free Short Term and Long Term Disability
Heavily subsidized Cafeteria plan at Gerstenberg
Employee Car program for employees driving 6,000 miles per year at work
cons: I like it here. Not a lot of bad things to say.  Are they doing everything right?  No, but  it's not for lack of effort.

job_title: Administrative Support in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: I highly recommend this company. They have excellent benefits, health insurance, 401k and a generous vacation (PTO-paid time off) accrual system. Salaries are competitive and most instances above market rate. They have an open access program for their patients, which means that they cover and pay for some services out of their pocket. This is unique in the industry and has attracted me to this company.
cons: Regardless of which hospice you work for you should realize that caring for patients at the end of life can be very stressful and emotionally challenging. Some of the issues for hospice workers like any other healthcare provider are the physical demands of patient care such as standing for long periods, lifting or moving patients, and unique to hospice is the frequent travel for home visits.

job_title: Care Manager in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: I have to give Trustbridge some high props for the benefits package.  Earlier this year I had to go to the ER – and my health insurance took care of 96% of the bill.  Compared to the last company I worked for, the coverage is better and my payroll deduction for the premium is over $100 per paycheck lower here.  Overall it’s a good place to work.  Like any place there are ups and down.  Within the past few months I received my second promotion.  It has been a challenge, but I like that.  I have a great relationship with my manager.  She’s pretty open about things and all of us appreciate that.
cons: You have to love doing a detailed job!  There are lots of them.

review_title: Upper management is terrible and out of touch ..
job_title: Registered Nurse in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Working with the dying is extremely meaningful work! My coworkers worked closely together as a great team !
cons: Nurse:patient ratios on the unit were way too high !  Sometimes they would give me 8 acutely ill patients, on the unit, and that was awful . Most of the time 6! Patients /families were being neglected because of this and patients did not get the care that they deserved ...

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: TrustBridge is an excellent company that truly cares about its employees.  They have hard working and dedicated employees that work as a team.  Above the employees, the type of work and lives that we impact is the best reasons to work here!  If Hospice care is in your heart, then this is the place for you!
cons: The company is growing and with that growth comes some growing pains.  The team is hard at work making steps towards making processes more efficient.

job_title: Staff RN in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: The people and patients I work with.
cons:
In all these years nothing has changed.  Administration is still out of touch.
For them it is a numbers game, more patients more money. Can not retain people buth they never ask themselves why. Staff knows why. You can not retain people when you treat them like second class citizens. All levels of administration dictates and are not interested in what the working staff wants and needs are.  Morale is still in the bucket.  Turn over remains high. Administration remain unapprochable. With all the comments on Glassdoor nothing has changed in all these years.  Only getting worse. Do not work here.    ----R.N.

review_title: more business than hospice care for the patients
job_title: Staff RN in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Many very qualified staff members and the physicians are supportive of the nurses and willing to teach., patients and families.
cons: They care more about their business relationships with the nursing homes the patients live in then the patients themselves . For example a patients family and the patient did not want physical therapy. The hospice nurse informed the facility staff of the patients choice, and was then written up because the facility complained to the hospice management .

job_title: in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Great to be able to care for these special patients and family.
cons: Once upon a time it was a really great place to work for. Now it's gone down the drain. Management does not really care for the staff anymore. They are not appreciated. Non friendly environment. Management is out to get the employees and make their job miserable. They want to impost a harsh environment. There attitude is, our way or the high way.

review_title: Terrible Management - Do Not Work Here!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good benefits, good close location.

review_title: A place to avoid if you can

review_title: Worked extremely hard, many changes which made it harder for worker bees to have a somewhat smooth day.

job_title: in Miami, FL
pros: They are great at sales but miserable at delivery. They come on strong with a sales pitch. They say don't worry, we will take care of all your hospice needs
cons: If you want your loved one to pass in peace avoid them. If I could give negative stars I would. They did not send after several repeated attempts. They are supposed to make a dying person comfortable. Instead, they have so many empty promises and excuses. It is awful.
